page.title: 08Newhouse, Redlynch 1
page.content: Newhouse was built just before 1619 to a Y-shaped design.The Eyres bought Newhouse in 1633 and added two wings in the 18th century.Later Victorian additions were demolished in 1972, riddled with dry rot. The Eyres were united with the Matchams in 1817 and their descendants still own Newhouse.The house has connections with Admiral Lord Nelson, his sister being Catherine Matcham. Horatia, daughter of Nelson and Lady Hamilton spent much of her childhood at Newhouse. The house contains several Nelson mementoes including articles of clothing, a lock of hair, his chair from HMS Victory and two rare paintings on glass depicting his death and funeral barge.Horatia's cradle is also on display.
